body_html:
@tudor-berariu I think your GPU backward timings are wrong due to a typo here it should be total and not t.
If you compute the difference by hand between the GPU and CPU time, you have a backward that is always ~1.5s.

The variance on the CPU runtime is quite weird though.

EDIT: running your script with the typo fixed give the following timings for the two commit https://gist.github.com/albanD/1001a9500fe1ff0363bd6956d67013d6
Did you had big difference in CPU load when running your tests?
body_text:
@tudor-berariu I think your GPU backward timings are wrong due to a typo here it should be total and not t.
If you compute the difference by hand between the GPU and CPU time, you have a backward that is always ~1.5s.
The variance on the CPU runtime is quite weird though.
EDIT: running your script with the typo fixed give the following timings for the two commit https://gist.github.com/albanD/1001a9500fe1ff0363bd6956d67013d6
Did you had big difference in CPU load when running your tests?
body:
@tudor-berariu I think your GPU backward timings are wrong due to a typo [here](https://github.com/bit-ml/tensor-benchmarks/blob/219fffee72b7493cd14bdc2890e92be601c83a05/nn_benchmark.py) it should be `total` and not `t`.
If you compute the difference by hand between the GPU and CPU time, you have a backward that is always ~1.5s.

The variance on the CPU runtime is quite weird though. 

EDIT: running your script with the typo fixed give the following timings for the two commit https://gist.github.com/albanD/1001a9500fe1ff0363bd6956d67013d6
Did you had big difference in CPU load when running your tests?
